page.title: 01Introduction _Kingswood Area
page.content: Kingswood District is a suburb,lying to the East of Bristol and is a popular{residential area}for city workers.The population of 87,244 is concentrated to the West of the District but the Southern part is now {catching the eye of developers.}As well as the new Kings Chase shopping centre{small industries}include printing,engineering and manufacture of furniture and foodstuffs.The area has been known for its deer hunting,coal mining,boot and shoe making,non-conformist religious revivals and W.G.Grace(cricketer). {Recreation}is now important,the disused railway has become a cycle path and industrial waste tips have been incorporated into the Conham river park.In contrast green open space is being overwhelmed by housing,small industries and roads.
